item.title: How to use Rmarkdown in RStudio
item.description: Markdown Markdown files (.md) are common type of plain text files. Markdown is a ‘lightweight markup language,’ which means it’s easy for humans to read, and computers can convert it to HyperText Markup Language (HTML). Markdown allows for some formatting options to aid with communication (see below) <!-- comments --> normal text *italic* **bold** > quote `code` # h1 ## h2 ### h3 #### h4 ##### h5 ###### h6 To learn more, see Markdown Syntax Documentation on John Gruber’s site.

item.title: File management with fs
item.description: TLDR: This post covers how to keep track of all your files and documnets in a data analysis project.
